actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Reported to House from the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1668.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure laid on table in House, S. 553 passed in lieu.

official_title: A bill to modify the boundary of the Cibola National Forest, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1668) Modifies the exterior boundary of the Cibola National Forest, New Mexico, to include additional acreage. Conditions the inclusion of such land upon the city of Albuquerque acquiring a certain tract. Designates specified acres as "intended wilderness" to be part of the Sandia Mountain Wilderness. Provides that any lands owned by the United States in the described tract, or any lands acquired by the Secretary of Interior and transferred to the Secretary of Agriculture, shall be administered in accordance with the laws, rules, and regulations applicable to the National Forest System. Authorizes appropriations, not to exceed $12,000,000, from the Land and Water Conservation Fund for acquisition of the described lands.

titles.title: A bill to modify the boundary of the Cibola National Forest, and for other purposes.
